alert.note: Alert for Caldwell (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 3:04PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CALDWELL PARISH THROUGH 345 PM CST... At 304 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Buckner to near Columbia to near Clarks. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Clarks, Grayson, and Riverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central Louisiana.
